title: Compressor 4.1.1 [MAS]
description:
Compressor adds power and flexibility to Final Cut Pro X export.

Customize output settings, work faster with distributed encoding, and tap into a comprehensive set of delivery features.

Powerful Encoding for Final Cut Pro 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Use Compressor to customize encoding settings available in Final Cut Pro
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Choose from a wide array of codecs, sizes, frame rates, and other parameters 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Save your custom settings in Compressor; they automatically appear in Final Cut Pro
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Share settings with other editors, even if Compressor isn't installed on their workstations 

Time-Saving Encoding Workflow 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Work fast using a single-window interface and preset Destinations for common encoding tasks
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Experiment freely with encoding options, using real-time feedback in the Preview window
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Find exactly the setting you need in just a few clicks in the updated settings library
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Set up batch processes to streamline the encoding of large numbers of files 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Build custom Destinations to combine encoding with tasks such as moving or copying files
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Create self-contained Droplets to encode on the desktop with drag-and-drop ease 

Industry-Standard Encoding Support 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Use one-step settings for Apple devices and websites such as Vimeo, YouTube, and Facebook
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Work with a choice of themed menus to encode and burn a DVD or Blu-ray disc
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Add chapter markers for discs or podcasts distributed on iPad, iPhone, iPod, or Apple TV 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Encode to a broad range of industry-standard formats, such as MPEG-2, H.264, and ProRes
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Generate files for HTTP live streaming in a single step 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Import Targa, DPX, TIFF, PSD, or PNG image sequences and encode them to any setting
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Tap into advanced encoding features for adding closed captioning, metadata, and more 

Pristine Format Conversions 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Convert any file from its source format to another format, such as NTSC to PAL or SD to HD
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Clean up and customize your content using image filters, a timecode overlay, and watermarks
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Speed up video, slow it down, or adjust the frame rate to make the duration match a runtime 

Distributed Encoding 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Save time by distributing encoding work among multiple cores and workstations
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Install Compressor on any Mac to activate it as a node for distributed encoding 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Speed up encoding in Final Cut Pro by choosing a group of shared computers for exporting

System Requirements: OS X v10.9 or later, 4GB of RAM (8GB recommended for 4K), OpenCL-capable graphics card or Intel HD Graphics 3000 or later, 256MB of VRAM (1GB recommended for 4K), 1.1GB of disk space. 

Some features require Internet access; fees may apply. Blu-ray recorder required for burning Blu-ray discs.

Whats New in Version 4.1
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ New interface with a single-window layout and streamlined controls
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Preset Destinations for common encoding tasks
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Simplified setup for distributed encoding
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Hardware-based H.264 encoding in supported Share operations
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Support for Dolby Digital Plus encoding
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Share directly to YouTube at 4K resolution
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Share directly to Chinese video sites Youku and Tudou
